oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Benefits from cover crops based on plant-microbial interaction
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Manici , L.M.
Kelderer, M.
Caputo, F.
De Luca Picione , F.
Topp, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil biology
Biodiversity and ecosystem services
Fruit and berries
Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This study was performed on the impact of two different cover crops (cereal and legume) on composition of root fungal endophytes and rhizospheric bacterial communities as a function of crop health in replanted apple orchards.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Manici , L.M.; Kelderer, M.; Caputo, F.; De Luca Picione , F. and Topp, A. (2014) Benefits from cover crops based on plant-microbial interaction. In: Pep贸, P and Csajb贸k, J. (Eds.) Proceeding of 13th ESA Congress, University of Debrecen, Debrecen Hungary, pp. 133-134.
